cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 200 miles SSE of Port Arthur, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts, then turning north across Louisiana and Arkansas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas-Louisiana border, roughly in the Cameron-Port Arthur area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch east of Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City, LA; Storm-Surge Watch from the Mouth of the Mississippi River to Ocean Springs, MS, including interior lakes
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Freeport, TX to the Mouth of the Mississippi River; Hurricane Warning San Luis Pass, TX to Intracoastal City, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-west Gulf Coast from Freeport, TX through Sea Rim State Park, TX to Intracoastal City, LA with catastrophic surge and extreme winds
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) are likely this evening with a 23 % chance of hurricane-force gusts; strongest winds expected overnight as Laura passes just east
weather_observation.storm_surge: Forecast 2–4 ft above ground level in Galveston Bay; locally higher 6–9 ft possible just east of Port Bolivar
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches possible with isolated totals to 15 inches; risk of flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornado threat beginning this evening
